# Community Partner Recruitment Criteria

**Purpose:** Guidelines for community partners recruiting participants for Vibe Entrepreneurship cohorts
**Audience:** Community organizations, career centers, workforce development partners
**Date:** 2025-11-04

---

## Program Overview for Partners

**Vibe Entrepreneurship** is a 4-week, virtual entrepreneurship program for individuals at or below 150% of the US federal poverty line. Participants will:
- Attend 8 virtual group sessions (2x per week, 90 minutes each, via Zoom)
- Work with AI agents to develop their business ideas between sessions
- Create weekly management reports and project reviews
- Engage with peer community (Slack or WhatsApp)

**Format:** Virtual (requires computer/internet access)
**Cost:** Free for all participants
**Technology:** Web-based portal (modern browser required), Zoom

---

## Baseline Digital Literacy Requirements

To ensure participant success, please recruit individuals who meet these **minimum technology requirements:**

### ✅ Required (Minimum Bar)

**Computer & Internet Access:**
- [ ] Has access to a computer or laptop (desktop preferred over mobile for 4 weeks)
- [ ] Has reliable internet connection
- [ ] Can commit to accessing technology 5-7 days/week for 4 weeks

**Basic Computer Skills:**
- [ ] Can use a web browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
- [ ] Can type basic sentences on a keyboard (accuracy more important than speed)
- [ ] Can use email (send, receive, read)
- [ ] Can join a Zoom meeting with support

**Digital Comfort:**
- [ ] Willing to learn new technology tools
- [ ] Comfortable asking for help with technology
- [ ] Has used smartphone apps or websites regularly

### ⚠️ Acceptable with Support

Participants who need support in these areas are welcome, but should be aware of learning curve:
- Slow typing speed (< 20 words per minute)
- Limited web browser experience (only uses 1-2 websites regularly)
- Never used Zoom before (we'll provide orientation)
- Uncomfortable with AI chat tools (we'll provide training in Session 1)

### ❌ Not Ready (Yet)

Participants who meet these criteria should complete digital literacy training before joining:
- Cannot type sentences on keyboard
- No access to computer or reliable internet (and partner cannot provide)
- Never used email or web browser
- Uncomfortable using technology at all

**For these individuals:** Please offer foundational digital literacy training first, then refer to future cohorts.

---

## Screening Questions for Recruitment

Use these questions to assess technology readiness:

### **1. Technology Access**

**Q: "Do you have regular access to a computer and internet?"**
- ✅ Yes, I have my own computer/laptop and internet
- ✅ Yes, I can use a computer at library/community center regularly
- ⚠️ Sometimes (inconsistent access) → May struggle, discuss alternatives
- ❌ No → Not ready unless partner provides equipment

**Q: "What device do you use most often for internet?"**
- ✅ Computer or laptop (ideal)
- ⚠️ Smartphone or tablet (acceptable but challenging for 4-week program)
- ❌ No regular device → Not ready

---

### **2. Digital Literacy**

**Q: "How comfortable are you using a computer? (1-5 scale)"**
- 1 = Never used, uncomfortable
- 2 = Used a few times, need lots of help
- 3 = Can do basic tasks (email, web browsing) with some help
- 4 = Comfortable with most computer tasks
- 5 = Very comfortable, use daily

**Benchmark:**
- ✅ 3+ = Ready
- ⚠️ 2 = Marginal, discuss with participant
- ❌ 1 = Needs foundational training first

**Q: "Can you send and receive emails?"**
- ✅ Yes, I do this regularly → Good sign
- ⚠️ Yes, but I need help sometimes → Acceptable
- ❌ No, I don't use email → Red flag

**Q: "Have you ever joined a Zoom meeting?"**
- ✅ Yes, I'm comfortable with Zoom → Great
- ⚠️ No, but I'm willing to learn → Acceptable (we'll provide orientation)
- ❌ No, and I'm nervous about video calls → May struggle

---

### **3. AI & Chat Tool Experience**

**Q: "Have you used ChatGPT, Siri, Alexa, or similar AI tools?"**
- ✅ Yes, I use ChatGPT or similar → Excellent
- ⚠️ I've used Siri/Alexa (voice assistants) → Some familiarity
- ⚠️ No, but I'm willing to try → Acceptable (we'll train in Session 1)
- ❌ No, and I don't trust AI → May not be right fit for AI-based program

**Note:** No prior AI experience required, but openness to learning is essential.

**Q: "How do you feel about typing messages to get help (like texting)?"**
- ✅ Comfortable, I text or message regularly → Good
- ⚠️ I can do it, but slowly → Acceptable
- ❌ I don't like typing, prefer talking → May struggle with chat-based agents

---

### **4. Motivation & Commitment**

**Q: "Can you commit to 8 sessions over 4 weeks (2x per week, 90 minutes each)?"**
- ✅ Yes, I can attend all or most sessions
- ⚠️ Maybe, I have some schedule conflicts → Discuss flexibility
- ❌ No, my schedule is too unpredictable → Not ready for this cohort

**Q: "Can you spend 3-5 hours per week working on your business between sessions?"**
- ✅ Yes → Realistic expectation
- ⚠️ Maybe, I have limited time → Discuss time constraints
- ❌ No, I have no extra time → May not complete program

**Q: "Are you willing to learn new technology tools to help your business?"**
- ✅ Yes, I'm excited to learn → Great attitude
- ⚠️ Yes, but I'm nervous → We'll support you
- ❌ No, I want to do it the old way → AI program may not be right fit

---

## What We'll Provide (Support from Vibe Team)

**Technology Orientation:**
- Session 1 includes 10-15 minutes of AI/chat tool training
- Portal has "guided mode" toggle for simplified interface
- Human facilitators provide tech support during sessions

**What We WON'T Provide (Partner Responsibility):**
- Foundational computer literacy training (using mouse, keyboard, browser basics)
- Devices or internet access (unless partner arranges)
- Extensive 1-on-1 tech support (group support only)

---

## Support Resources Partners Can Provide

**To increase participant success, partners can:**

### **Option 1: Pre-Cohort Digital Literacy Training**
Offer 2-3 sessions (60-90 min each) covering:
- How to use web browser (open tabs, navigate, fill out forms)
- How to use email (send, receive, attachments)
- How to join Zoom meetings
- Basic typing practice

**Target audience:** Individuals at Level 1-2 digital literacy (move them to Level 3)

---

### **Option 2: Provide Technology Access**
If participants lack devices/internet:
- Loan laptops or Chromebooks for 4-week cohort
- Provide internet hotspots or partner with libraries for access
- Offer on-site computer lab access during cohort

**Cost consideration:** Budget for ~5-10 device loans per cohort

---

### **Option 3: Tech Buddy System**
- Pair less tech-savvy participants with more experienced peers
- Create WhatsApp/Slack group for quick tech questions
- Encourage "call me if stuck" culture

---

## Sample Recruitment Language

**For flyers, emails, social media:**

> **Vibe Entrepreneurship - Free 4-Week Program**
>
> Turn your business idea into reality with AI-powered support!
>
> **What you need:**
> - Business idea or desire to start a business
> - Access to computer & internet
> - Basic computer skills (email, web browsing)
> - Willingness to learn new tools
>
> **What you'll get:**
> - 8 group sessions with expert facilitators
> - AI agents to help with market research, planning, and execution
> - Peer community of fellow entrepreneurs
> - Hands-on support to launch your venture
>
> **100% FREE. Virtual format. No tech experience beyond basics required.**
>
> [Apply Now]

---

## Red Flags to Watch For

**During recruitment, be cautious if participant:**
- Has no device or internet and no plan to get access
- Refuses to use technology ("I'll just write things on paper")
- Expects program to be in-person or phone-based only
- Has never sent an email or used a website
- Is not willing to type (only wants to talk/call)

**These may indicate poor fit** for this AI-based, virtual cohort model.

---

## Success Profile: Ideal Participant

**Technology:**
- Has own computer/laptop or consistent library access
- Uses email and websites regularly (even if slowly)
- Comfortable learning new tools
- Willing to try AI chat (even if unfamiliar)

**Commitment:**
- Can attend 6-8 of 8 sessions
- Has 3-5 hours/week for business work
- Motivated to start or grow a business

**Attitude:**
- Open-minded about technology
- Willing to ask for help
- Resilient when facing tech challenges

**Income:**
- At or below 150% US federal poverty line (program eligibility)

---

Use this to track recruitment:

```
Participant Name: _______________________
Date Screened: _______________________

TECHNOLOGY ACCESS:
[ ] Computer/laptop access (own or regular library)
[ ] Reliable internet
[ ] Can commit to 5-7 days/week access

DIGITAL LITERACY:
[ ] Comfort level: 1  2  3  4  5  (circle one, need 3+)
[ ] Can use email (Y/N)
[ ] Can use web browser (Y/N)
[ ] Willing to learn Zoom (Y/N)

AI/CHAT EXPERIENCE:
[ ] Used ChatGPT/AI before (Y/N)
[ ] Comfortable typing messages (Y/N)
[ ] Open to learning AI tools (Y/N)

COMMITMENT:
[ ] Can attend 8 sessions (Y/N)
[ ] Has 3-5 hrs/week for business work (Y/N)
[ ] Motivated to start business (Y/N)

RECOMMENDATION:
[ ] READY - Strong fit for current cohort
[ ] READY WITH SUPPORT - Acceptable with tech training in Session 1
[ ] NEEDS PREP - Recommend digital literacy training first, then future cohort
[ ] NOT A FIT - Suggest alternative programs

NOTES:
_________________________________________________
_________________________________________________
```
